content.description: A business journal reports that the probability that Internet users in the United States will use a mobile payment app is 0.60. The journal claims this indicates that out of 5 randomly selected Internet users, 3 will use the mobile payment app.
content.question: Is the business journal interpreting the probability correctly?

choices.label: No, because the Internet users are not independent of each other.
No, because only 60% of all people use the Internet.
No, because 0.60 represents probability in the long run for many Internet users.
Yes, because Internet users are selected at random.
Yes, because 3 out of 5 is equal to 60%.

content.answer: No, because 0.60 represents probability in the long run for many Internet users.
